streak.schedulers

Interface Scheduler


  • public interface Scheduler
    The scheduler is responsible for scheduling and executing tasks asynchronously. The scheduler provides an "abstract asynchronous boundary" to stream operators.

    The scheduler has an internal clock that represents time as a monotonically increasing int value. The value may or may not have a direct relationship to wall-clock time and the unit of the value is defined by the implementation..

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int now()
      Return a value representing the "current time" of the scheduler.
      default SchedulerTask schedule(Runnable task)
      Schedules the execution of the given task as soon as possible but still asynchronously.
      default SchedulerTask schedule(Runnable task, int delay)
      Schedules the execution of the given task after a specified delay.
      SchedulerTask schedule(Runnable task, int initialDelay, int period)
      Schedules the periodic execution of the given task with specified period, after a specified delay.
      default SchedulerTask scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable task, int period)
      Schedules the periodic execution of the given task with specified period.
      void shutdown()
      Initiate an orderly shutdown of the scheduler.

    • Method Detail

      • now

        int now()
        Return a value representing the "current time" of the scheduler.
        Returns:
        the "current time" of the scheduler.

      • schedule

        @Nonnull default SchedulerTask schedule(@Nonnull Runnable task)
        Schedules the execution of the given task as soon as possible but still asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute.
        Returns:
        the SchedulerTask instance that can be used to cancel execution of task.

      • schedule

        @Nonnull default SchedulerTask schedule(@Nonnull Runnable task,
                                        int delay)
        Schedules the execution of the given task after a specified delay.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute.
        delay - the delay before the task should execute.
        Returns:
        the SchedulerTask instance that can be used to cancel execution of task.

      • scheduleAtFixedRate

        @Nonnull default SchedulerTask scheduleAtFixedRate(@Nonnull Runnable task,
                                                   int period)
        Schedules the periodic execution of the given task with specified period.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute.
        period - the period after execution when the task should be re-executed. A negative value is invalid while a value of 0 indicates that the task is never rescheduled.
        Returns:
        the SchedulerTask instance that can be used to cancel execution of task.

      • schedule

        @Nonnull SchedulerTask schedule(@Nonnull Runnable task,
                                int initialDelay,
                                int period)
        Schedules the periodic execution of the given task with specified period, after a specified delay.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute.
        initialDelay - the initial delay before the task should execute.
        period - the period after execution when the task should be re-executed. A negative value is invalid while a value of 0 indicates that the task is never rescheduled.
        Returns:
        the SchedulerTask instance that can be used to cancel execution of task.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Initiate an orderly shutdown of the scheduler. No new tasks will be accepted but previously submitted tasks may be completed depending on the policy of the underlying scheduler.

        Note: It is expected that this will be eliminated from the public interface exposed to user code and will only be visible internally to the framework.
